business.headline: Are stock markets closed on December 25? Check the full 2025 holiday scheduleOn regular weekdays, the stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day.

Which Indian insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.

Carraro India IPO: Check GMP, price band and subscription statusCarraro India IPO is a Rs 1,250 crore offer for sale (OFS) consisting of 1.77 crore shares. As this is a pure OFS, the entire proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not raise fresh capital.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Latest subscription status, GMP; listing dateThe IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.

Sagility India share price rises 5% to hit upper circuit today. Here's why Sagility India debuted on the stock market with an issue price of Rs 30 per share. At its current level, the stock has surged over 63% from the IPO price, underscoring strong investor interest.

Ventive Hospitality IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for biddingRetail investors must apply for a minimum of 23 shares per lot, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,789 for retail applicants.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as market rally loses steam; TCS gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.25 points to 78,587.42, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 10.80 points to 23,764.25 as of 9:30 AM.

DAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: The allotment status can be checked by investors through the websites of either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) or Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Mamata Machinery IPO allotment: Investors who have bid can check their allotment status online by logging in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Vedanta, Adani Enterprises, TVS Motor Several companies are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments. Among them are Vedanta, Prestige Estates, Wipro, Adani Enterprises, and TVS Motor.
IPOs in 2024: Big ticket listings that failed to impressRecord-breaking IPOs in India coexist with the struggles of billion-dollar listings, reflecting both market resilience and investor caution.
Sensex ends 400 points higher, Nifty jumps as heavyweight stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 498.58 points to end at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45.

NSE, BSE to keep markets open on February 1 for Union Budget 2025The practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Should you subscribe? Check GMP, subscription Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.
From the world's richest to fifth: The ups and downs of Bernard Arnault Once the world's richest, Bernard Arnault lost $32 billion in 2024 but remains a luxury titan with LVMH's 75 iconic brands.

Salted, pre-packed or caramelised? Popcorn gets stuck in GST mazeThe GST Council's decision to impose different tax rates on salted, pre-packaged, and caramelised popcorn has faced criticism, with economists, industry experts, and former government officials arguing that the new tax structure adds complexity for consumers.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check latest GMP, share price, allotment date Mamata Machinery IPO: The price band for the IPO is set between Rs 230 and Rs 243 per share. Investors can apply for a minimum lot size of 61 shares, which requires a retail investment of Rs 14,823.

PM-JAY for senior citizens: How to register for free health insuranceAyushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana ensures senior citizens over 70 get free health insurance of Rs 5 lakh annually, with a simple enrolment process to make healthcare more accessible.

F&O gamble: 5 reasons why options trading is a losing game for retail tradersOne of the biggest challenges retail traders face in India is the prohibitively high transaction costs. Unlike in the US, where brokerage fees are negligible and there are no transaction taxes, Indian traders face multiple layers of charges.
GSTR-9 simplified: Filing, features, deadlines and other details GSTR-9 consolidates GST data for taxpayers exceeding Rs 2 crore turnover, ensuring accurate reconciliation and compliance.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Allu Arjun questioned by Hyderabad cops in Pushpa 2 stampede caseAllu Arjun is being questioned by the Hyderabad Police over the death of a 35-year-old woman in a stampede at Sandhya Theatre during Pushpa 2's premiere on December 4.

Flawed selection process: Congress on appointment of human rights panel chiefCongress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge said the selection process of the NHRC chief was "flawed" and showed the "dismissive approach of the government".

RG Kar rape case: No evidence of struggle at crime scene, says forensic reportRG Kar Rape Case: The body of the trainee doctor was found inside the seminar hall of RG Kar hospital on August 9, triggering widespread outrage. The CBI has filed a charge-sheet against prime accused Sanjay Roy.

Rohit backs 'modern-day great' Virat, tight-lipped about his batting spotAustralia vs India, 4th Test: India captain Rohit Sharma expressed confidence in Virat Kohli overcoming his struggles outside the off-stump. However, the skipper refrained from revealing his batting position for the Boxing Day Test, adding to the speculation.

Diet Coke with protein shake? The new viral drink is not what experts recommendProtein Diet Coke is a blend of Diet Coke and a flavoured protein shake (mostly vanilla) that Rebecca Gordan, a teacher from Utah, introduced.

Agra gym trainer, posing as RAW agent, rapes Canadian woman he met on TinderOn her return to Canada, the woman found that she was pregnant. When she informed him of her condition, the gym trainer, Sahil, threatened and blocked her.

Farmer garlands minister with onions on stage in protest over price dropFarmers in Maharashtra protest plummeting onion prices by placing a garland of onions on Minister Nitesh Rane. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar urged the Centre to remove the 20 per cent export duty, citing farmer distress and climate challenges amid surplus crops.

Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.

Isro Spadex mission: Where one satellite will catch another in spaceSpaDeX becomes crucial since the Indian space agency has a series of ambitious missions on the horizon, each requiring advanced docking technologies.

Maharashtra man gives triple talaq to wife for refusing to sleep with his bossAfter the wife refused to sleep with her husband's boss, the accused physically assaulted her, gave her instant talaq and threw her out of the house in Maharashtra's Kalyan.

Australian teenager Sam Konstas to debut in Boxing Day Test vs IndiaAustralia vs India: Sam Konstas is set to make his debut in the Boxing Day Test against India, with Australia coach Andrew McDonald confirming his selection.

Congress leader's complaint against Allu Arjun over urination scene in Pushpa 2A Congress leader in Telangana has filed a complaint against Allu Arjun and the "Pushpa 2" team over a controversial scene in the film, which shows the actor urinating in a swimming pool.

Uber reacts to man's claim of different fares for same trip on different phonesSharing his experience in a post, the man noted, "Same pickup point, destination, and time but two different phones get two different rates. It happens with me as I always get higher rates on my Uber compared to my daughter's phone."

Will behead their leaders: Israel confirms it killed Hamas leader Haniyeh in IranIsraeli Defence Minister Israel Katz said his country would damage the strategic infrastructure of the Houthis and would "behead their leaders just as we did to Ismail Haniyeh, Yahya Sinwar and Hassan Nasrallah in Tehran".

Wanted drug smuggler shot dead in California; Brar, Godara gangs claim attackSunil Yadav, a drug smuggler, was killed in California's Stockton on Monday. He had used a fake passport to flee India to Dubai and then the US two years ago.

What has forced Pakistan govt to discuss Imran Khan's release?The Pakistani government is in talks with the party of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan. Internal pressure and growing calls for Khan's release globally by influential people have made the government discuss Khan's release, among other issues with PTI.

Odyssey: Christopher Nolan's next with Tom-Zendaya, adapted from Homer's epicChristopher Nolan is set to direct a new film titled The Odyssey, featuring a stellar cast including Matt Damon, Tom Holland, and Zendaya. The film is an adaptation of Homer's epic poem.

Why number of women in Indian workforce stagnates despite inclusive initiativesTheir 18 per cent representation in the workforce in FY2024 is marginally lower than the previous year and no different from FY2021 when it was just 19 per cent

Dalit boy invited to birthday, stripped, urinated upon in UP; dies by suicideThe victim's family alleged that the boy was invited to a birthday party where he was brutally assaulted, stripped and urinated upon by four people who even filmed the heinous act.

Eat popcorn and sleep: Shashi Tharoor on GST council's tax formula for snackCongress MP Shashi Tharoor mocked the GST Council's decision to impose varied popcorn tax slabs, sparking criticism of the system's complexity. Congress leaders called the move absurd, highlighting widespread GST evasion, tax fraud, and loopholes in compliance processes.
Meet India's favourite 3-row SUV, has over 1 lakh sales this yearThis SUV has multiple petrol and diesel powertrain options.

Video: UP men scream, beg to stop as truck drags them for 500 metresA truck driver dragged two people for about 500 metres in Agra under his vehicle. Some locals forced the driver to stop the truck and extricated the men from under the vehicle. Police arrested the driver and seized the truck.

Ex-Trump attorney general pick paid thousands for drugs, sex with minor: ReportThe House Ethics Committee accused ex-Representative Matt Gaetz of paying for sex, violating Florida's statutory rape law, and using illicit drugs.

Vinod Kambli has clots in brain, reveals doctor after medical examinationsFormer India cricketer Vinod Kambli has been hospitalised in Thane after his health deteriorated and the medical examinations have revealed that the cricketer has clots in his brain.

Varun Dhawan visits Mahakaleshwar Temple with Atlee, Keerthy Suresh and othersAhead of the highly-anticipated release of his film Baby John, actors Varun Dhawan, Keerthy Suresh and Wamiqa Gabbi, among others, visited the Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain and sought blessings from the lord. Baby John will release in theatres on December 25.

Kandyse McClure on Virgin River, Priyanka Chopra, and Diversity in Hollywood, Connection to India In an exclusive interview by India Today's Bhavna Agarwal with Kandyse McClure as she opens up about her character on Virgin River and shares heartfelt insights into being a woman of color in Hollywood, drawing inspiration from icons like Priyanka Chopra and Viola Davis, and what it means to carve a unique path in the entertainment industry.

Justin Baldoni's woman advocacy honour pulled amid Blake Lively's harassment claimsActor Justin Baldoni's award for women's advocacy has been rescinded. This follows the sexual harassment lawsuit and smear campaign allegations levelled against him by his It Ends With Us co-star, Blake Lively.

Kichcha Sudeep: Struggles to stardom, inspiring journey of Sandalwood superstarKichcha Sudeep, one of Kannada cinema's most celebrated stars, is a multifaceted talent whose journey to stardom is as inspiring as it is compelling. From being labelled an 'Iron Leg' to earning the title 'Abhinaya Chakravarthy', here's Sudeep's journey towards stardom.

sports.headline: No regrets about not captaining India, but would have enjoyed it: R AshwinR Ashwin played 106 Tests and took 537 wickets, but the legendary off-spinner did not get an opportunity to lead the senior national team in the longest format of the game. Ashwin retired from international cricket on December 18.

Niki Prasad to lead India's 15-member squad for ICC U19 Women's T20 World CupNiki Prasad will lead India's strong 15-member squad for the ICC U19 Women's T20 World Cup, scheduled in Malaysia from January 18 to February 2, 2025. Niki led India to a title win at the inaugural ACC U19 Women's Asia Cup in Kuala Lumpur.

Manchester United manager questions Rashford camp over new challenge commentsManchester United boss Ruben Amorim has questioned the decision-making of individuals close to forward Marcus Rashford, who has been absent from the team's last three games.

England Test captain Ben Stokes out for three months due to torn hamstring England captain Ben Stokes has vowed to endure "blood, sweat, and tears" for England as he prepares for surgery in January. The all-rounder is set to be sidelined for at least three months due to a torn hamstring.

How have Pakistan performed in Boxing Day Tests in South Africa? SA vs PAK: Pakistan have their task cut out as they are set to lock horns with South Africa in a two-match Test series, starting December 26 at the SuperSport Park in Centurion.

Raphael Varane attends Lens vs PSG in disguise, spotted among fansRaphaël Varane, former Real Madrid and Manchester United defender, returned to his roots, watching RC Lens' French Cup clash against PSG disguised amongst fans. His heartfelt gesture highlighted his enduring connection to the club where his illustrious journey began.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
